docs.lead_paragraph: Timothy F. Geithner can't put his money where his mouth is. The Treasury secretary, who is to join G-20 finance ministers Friday and Saturday in Busan, South Korea, has lately been urging other countries to conduct bank stress tests. But his credibility falls short in at least one important respect: future tests are absent from America's financial regulatory overhaul.
